irc, fb status updates also have somewhat short message lengths

what do you think of this?
i would pay about $12 per month
My pleasure, excited to see where you guys take convore.
Also, my avatar made Techcrunch, I've already signed a multi-book deal thanks to that!

Exactly..and a way to block receiving/viewing their messages
what are you talk bout willis
it's fun watching the # of people online number go up
@aksports2003 I don't have time for people like this

The fact that the message is short. The interface does not look like it is inviting for us to write long answer
I'm just a convore user, i don't want to raise expectations of what I can get answered too much
because you know, a phone is twitter like as well
@emmyweb send me a 40 bucks and I'll ask around
I know there's no limit on words...as far as I know.
@emad Come on mate... It's web... you can make Money for doing nothing......
not sure how this is twitter like
nope but thanks for the offer
There's no limit on text length, so you can write long answers if you want to
One of the best things about convore IMO is the ability to leave a conversation and come back and catch up on it a day or two later
@emad Why r u only asking $40? That's insulting for this type of question.
@ericflo Great....BTW how many devs work on this project?
congrats on the launch guys, great converage

Sorry, not quite sure what you mean @aksports2003

And and people can easily spam.., what about that?
@aksports2003 I bet they use open source
@ is not just used for twitter
what language is this built in
or the @ is for this thing
she and i mean Phil is upset
i bet your momma is open source
It's whether people will use the product is what counts...Do u know that ur mother won't approve what u said just now? @aksports2003

@ericflo PHP? Python? With some C++ in the server end?
@ericflo U need to have a way to report people also. As in fb. I just saw a need for it now
@aksports2003 You think I was talking about u? Don't flatter yourself too much. You are not that important
convore is awesome and highly addictive
another useful feature would be sharing posts from public topics. I like this more than quora :)
Also.. what's being done to limit spam?
@simonw I bet it has - but you're back in a land of reliable internet connectivity now?
this has potential, like the UI and the initial experience. it will probably need some spam and troll countermeasures though.

Regarding our technology stack, we're Python, Django, Eventlet, nginx, PostgreSQL, Celery, Redis, Solr. We're hosted on Rackspace, use S3 for images, and MailGun for our e-mail, Hudson for CI, Trac for ticketing.
@ericflo How did you come up with the idea for convore?
@aksports2003 Who is this again? Can you help me to recall?
if aliens ever came down and judged the human race by the quality of comments on techcrunch
Need some way to filter the noise, block users etc
i think theres too much noise though, would be great to have the information sorted
not sure if that is applicable to a group chat type product like this
on a serious note: what time is it

made for some entertaining reading :-) Gonna shoot now - finding this site a bit too chaotic. Will check back in a few weeks to see if they've worked out how to promote good content (something involving the stars perhaps?). Anyway, nice to catch you briefly, cheerio
outside of the riffraff that this topic has attracted, there is some great discussion in other groups and in other topics
Lovely UI design, and very snappy. Pondering whether the web need a new chatroom, though?
@simonw so would you recommend Morroco as the place to be for new budding startups? :-)
i think thats what makes quora so usable for me. lots of information, but ordered in some way
what r u doing about it
ugh, the one bad thing about convore launching is that I'm reacquainting myself with techcrunch commenters
yes, very glad we got out of Egypt before it got turned off!
thanks - it's all been a bit of a whirlwind
Congrats on the launch. Reminds me a lot of hipchat as well, which is what our team uses.
@simonw howdy! Congrats on the funding for Lanyrd
but ergonomics isn't so important if you spend several hours a day out exploring
hah, yeah, morocco was surprisingly productive!
Thanks @chrisbeach but credit for the UI definitely goes to @etmaguire :)
(except for the lack of ergonomic chairs)
@ericflo great job with the UI - best of luck filtering the kids out!
it's a known fact that once you've thanked 1 eric, you've thanked them all.
I put the TechCrunch article on Reddit if anyone wants to upboat http://www.reddit.com/r/technology/comments/ficjh/y_combinatorbacked_convore_wants_to_be_the/
looks so easy to use! Good.
This thing is awesome. Great job guys! @ericflo
Fantastic job- Convore is definitely going straight to my bookmarks (right after github gist, before twitter)
@ck1125 Yes. When you go to create a group, you are given the option to make it private.
love this service... congrats for launching!
Nice job. Definitely fills a few social graph gaps for me. This will catch on.

This is good. This is what Twitter lists continually fail to be. Might be tough to manage the `recent topics' portion (How many is "recent?" Max topics per group to prevent irony-inducing full-feed effect. Etc.) Still, nice. Also, how long can I type here? Forever threatens scale. 140 will get derided. Big decisions ahead for Convore. Do this right and you could usurp the social firehose. Get it wrong and you'll be a TweetDeck plugin. Good luck.

@zac You're totally going to get voted off the group for that. :) Wait, that feature doesn't exist. When it does this will be Digg. Or they can truncate to 140, then this will be Twitter. Or they can auto-generate URLs for long messages, then this will be bit.ly. Decisions, decisions.
hey @modband on the topic of length, go look in "New test topic" I just managed to paste the entirety of "Huckleberry Finn: The Hipster Edition" and it worked
@ericflo Shouldn't you be like sleeping now :-)
I just realized why I love this UI - when you scroll down, only the feed scrolls. The rest of the page does not move. I've been trying to get people to do that for years. It makes so much sense.
Having said that - a back to top action would be nice. Especially on iPad.
There's not much value in this thread
@ido It was no easy feat, it made building everything else harder...but thanks for the props, it makes it all worth it :)
@ido Yeah, yeah I should probably be sleeping.
I just got caught up in the excitement :)
OK then, I'll head off to bed.  Lots and lots of bugs to fix tomorrow from all of the feedback today!
this should erase forums from the web!

i just signed up with Convore, and learning the ins and outs of it. So far not bad. I like the messages they have, like you win at life.
So we don't need irc any more, congratulations
Hey guys, you made it upside down, with old messages on top. Trying to.. turn head. I'll figure it out..

The red `new message' icons under "recent topics" need to be clickable. They're red and rounded and look like buttons, so make them button-like in function. Also yeah, put newest messages up top, not on the bottom. Also the Groups drop-down has weird functionality. It should simply take you to your groups, not display a long list of each topic within the groups. Also, the gray message count icons on the right need to be clickable, not just the numbers inside them. It's silly to have more clickable area in an "8" than a "1." Just make it work like a big button so humans can click on it.
Also, I like Convore, so the above is meant to be constructive and not annoying. :)
And the text entry field only allows for one line, which is janky if you're trying to re-read your post before submitting it.
Totally agree with @modband on the red icons. It looks like buttons, so I immediately tried to click on it.
be cool if convore supported embedding code snippets from https://gist.github.com? btw is there a convore wishlist group?
@chico We've just been dumping them in the Feedback group
@Mister_Helper This is how chat always has been
Guys, make a public "try it out" thingy without registration on the front page
agree if you want to be the easiest way to chat, you do not want to impose registration to your users
@misofr yeh but you also lose functionality as a developer not being able to "touch" end users
a cookie can do the job, of course can't switch computer ... but éh nothing's perfect ;)
Yeah, that would be really neat to be able to put gist code into here.
Wouldn't not requiring registration also make it that much easier to spam?
looks to me as they come from gravatar

@vonJohann If you aren't going to use one from Facebook or Twitter, just click on your name in the upper-right corner of the screen. That should take you to your profile page. Your picture will be displayed at full-size on the left, with a button which says "Change".
